priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Location of Most Severe Stenosis Within a Graft Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101851

self.title: CDISC SDTM Location of Most Severe Stenosis Within a Graft Terminology

definition: Terminology used to describe the part of the graft that is most severely stenotic.
name: Location of Most Severe Stenosis Within a Graft
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Location of Most Severe Stenosis Within a Graft Terminology
synonyms: Location of Most Severe Stenosis Within a Graft

terms.definition: The connection where the graft joins the aorta usually less than or equal to 3 mm from insertion point.
The portion of the graft that lies between its anastomoses.
The connection where the graft joins the coronary artery usually less than or equal to 3 mm from insertion point.
